Fix #19524.

I think this would have been regressed by 355c961.

data.title: #18696 Support line number fragments in vscode.open
data.body:
Implements #18696

Added support for line / column number fragments to `vscode.open` command. The parsing logic was taken from the link opening service at `vs/platform/opener/browser/openerService.ts`.

It seems like this logic should be consolidated somewhere, but I'm still new to the project and I'm not sure where the best place to add this kind of shared logic would be, and how to access it from both places that need it.

data.title: Extensions: Searching with extension name after @{group} filter
data.body:
Cannot search by extension name along with a group filter `@disabled` or @`outdated`

- Disable a couple extensions
- In the extensions search box, enter `@disabled foo` replacing `foo` with a word in one extension
- enter
- All extensions still show

This works for other filters, for example `@recommended npm`

data.title: Filter installed extensions
data.body:
I want to search within my installed extensions. Is there a way to do this already?

- Have many extensions installed
- Type search query
- It searches the whole marketplace with no easy option to only see installed extensions that match

Searching like `@installed format` would be great.

data.title: Monaco>DiffEditor>inline view>clicking + dragging over original lines will select text from new, even if using scrollbar
data.body:
- Monaco-editor Version: 0.8.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 Insider preview

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a diff-editor, inline view, readonly, where a section is present in the original/left but deleted in the modified/right. (The [demo page](https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/index.html) also shows this behavior.)
2. Scroll to the deleted section.
3. Click and drag on some of the red-highlighted text. **The editor will begin selecting before/after deleted section. This is expected and occurs in VSCode as well.**.
4. Scroll to a large deleted section, such that the red highlight of a deleted line is visible through the semi-transparent scrollbar.
5. Attempt to scroll by clicking and dragging on the scrollbar. **The editor will still attempt to highlight before/after the deleted text, which can make scrolling difficult if the deleted section is large because the editor will try to jump to the highlighted area**. This does not repro in VSCode, but does in recent versions of IE, Edge, and Chrome.

data.title: Multiple process debug dropdown doesn't show up in widget consistently
data.body:
- Start (for example) "Launch VS Code" config
- Start "Unit test" config
- Process picker dropdown doesn't show up

If I click "stop", then the first config is killed, and the second keeps running, and the process picker in the widget shows up at this point.

Or if I launch a third one, it shows up.

Or if I hit a breakpoint, it shows up.

data.title: Typescript breaks on startup
data.body:
I've seen this twice today,  opening a new instance of vscode.

I don't have a tsdk setting set. The output channel says `Using tsserver from location: undefined`. Error in console:

```
workbench.main.js:138 Path must be a string. Received undefined: TypeError: Path must be a string. Received undefined
    at assertPath (path.js:7:11)
    at Object.dirname (path.js:1326:5)
    at servicePromise.error (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptServiceClient.js:305:79)
    at modulePath.then.then.modulePath (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/out/typescriptServiceClient.js:301:35)
    at Object.m [as _notify] (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:5:30381)
    at Object.enter (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:1957)
    at _run (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:3785)
    at _completed (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:3226)
    at /Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:9892
    at done (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:5086)
    at Object.m [as _notify] (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:5:30523)
    at Object.enter (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:1957)
    at _run (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:3785)
    at _completed (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:6:3226)
    at e.resolveOk (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:8:17657)
    at d (/Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/node/extensionHostProcess.js:8:16129)
```

Then I reload the window and it works. Output channel says `Using tsserver from location: /Applications/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/extensions/typescript/node_modules/typescript/lib/tsserver.js`

<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Turn On screen reader on Ubuntu (http://askubuntu.com/questions/278693/how-do-i-stop-orca-screen-reader)
2. Open VS code
3. Naviagate through items with Tab key

Expected behavior:

Screen reader should read items. (as how it reads on Mac & Windows)

Actual behavior:

It doesn't read anything. 

Is this a known issue ? Do you know any alternative screen reading tool for ubuntu ?

Any help will be appreciated !

data.title: Crash in Windows VM after search
data.body:
From #17718, reported by @isidorn 

> win 10, vscode insiders latest
> 
> I also get to 90% after a minute of searing on my root drive, after that some results pop up but progress remains at around 90% and vscode becomes > unresponsive 
> 8 minutes later vscode is not unresponsive but very slow and progress still around 90%
> After 10 minutes - vscode crashes
> 
> ![screen shot 2017-01-26 at 16 54 19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22338618/1bfabeb2-e3e8-11e6-8075-42f6b99635fd.png)
> 
> A bunch of errors in console
> ```
> ipc.cp.ts:152 [IPC Library: Search] Uncaught Exception:  SyntaxError: Unexpected token  in JSON at position 0(anonymous function) @ ipc.cp.ts:152e.invoke > @ callbackList.ts:63e.fire @ event.ts:118r @ event.ts:12emitTwo @ events.js:106emit @ events.js:191process.nextTick @ > internal/child_process.js:744_combinedTickCallback @ internal/process/next_tick.js:67_tickCallback @ internal/process/next_tick.js:98
> ipc.cp.ts:152 [IPC Library: Search] SyntaxError: Unexpected token  in JSON at position 0
>     at Pipe.channel.onread (internal/child_process.js:448:28)
> ```

> I can repro it easily on my vm which has 2gb ram.
> No cpu spikes, I guess the vm just runs out of memory since it has a 2gb limit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Place multiple cursors in the page
2. Go to beginning of line for each cursor
3. Press tab (\t)

Only the first, original cursor, tabs. I don't see why that functionality happens when I can edit and select text all over with the multiple cursors. Why does tab have different functionality?

data.title: 'noDebug' flag not passed to debug adapter
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. set a breakpoint in node program
2. start a node debug session with "Start without Debugging" action

Observe: breakpoint is hit

I've debugged this and I saw that the "noDebug" flag isn't passed to the DA.

If you add a `"noDebug": true` to the launch config, the breakpoint is not hit, so the DA is working fine.

data.title: Navigate among the files while typing in the Explorer panel
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.14393]

Steps to Reproduce:
In Visual Studio, we could navigate between the files while typing to search the file or folder that we want to reach.

For example, let's suppose that we have the following structure on Explorer panel
- resources
- config
  + acl.php
  + app.php
  +benchmark.php
- config.testing
- database
- routes

If I start to type "c", "o", "n" with the focus inside the **Explorer bar**, so, the panel will set the focus to the **config** folder. Once inside the **config** folder and start to type "a", "p"... it will set the focus in the **app.php file**.

If the **Explorer** panel has the focus in the **resource** folder and we start to type "b", "e","n", the **Explorer** panel will set the focus to the **benchmark.php** or other file that starts with the chars "ben".

data.title: Feature Request: Select while jumping to matching bracket.
data.body: I would like some alternative version of the `Ctrl`+`Shift`+`\` command, which jumps to the matching bracket, that also selects while jumping. The obvious modifier key to use for that distinction would be `Shift`, which sadly is already used by the original function, so I suppose it would have to be `Ctrl`+`Shift`+`Alt`+`\` or something.

data.title: Feature Request: Hotkey to turn preview tab into real tab
data.body:
Very simple: I like preview mode a lot of the time. But sometimes I want to actually, for-real open several tabs using `Ctrl`+`P`. Currently, this means either an edit/undo cycle (ew), or grabbing the mouse and double-clicking the tab (even more ew).

I would therefore really like some way to turn a preview tab into a real tab without either editing the file or taking my hands off the keyboard.

data.title: GUI Becomes Unresponsive

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04.5 (issue occurred on older versions of 14.04, and Windows 7)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Load a folder with C++ code (~200k lines)
2. Compile, launch, and debug code (gcc) as usual
3. After leaving the tool open for somewhere between 24-48 hours, the GUI will eventually become unresponsive, sometimes sections of the window turn black. The GUI lockup usually occurs while navigating the code. The window can be resized, resulting in more black area. Button clicks still seem to have an effect. Keyboard commands will still trigger a builds. Hovering the mouse over areas where the buttons should appear bring up the hover-help text. The only recovery is to restart the window. Work is never lost because saving still works after the screen no longer updates.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch config
```json
  // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations":
   [
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch Program",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/bin/www",
      "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
    },
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "name": "Attach to Process",
      "port": 5858
    }
  ]
}
```
2. Add Configuration, pick Launch via npm

You get

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/22373806/bdf19d7e-e4a3-11e6-8b31-4d3239b66687.png)
